column4: is there any command to show the partition details instead of $ sudo fdisk -l ?
is there any command to show the partition details instead of $ sudo fdisk -l ?
gparted could show them.. but if they are not seen with 'sudo fdisk -l' then theres a problem.
thats when you need to look at the sizes and filesystem types , and perhaps mount one or 2 and see what ones are what.
